definition: to pretend ignorance of or fail to take action against something one ought to oppose
examples: The government connived in the rebels' military buildup.

definition: to be indulgent or in secret sympathy : wink
examples: The captain connived at the smuggling of goods aboard his ship.

definition: to cooperate secretly or have a secret understanding
examples: officials who connive with drug dealers
accused his opponents of conniving to defeat the proposal
